sentences:
1. A 29-year-old internal medicine resident presents to the emergency department with complaints of fevers, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and skin rash for 2 days.
2. He feels fatigued and has lost his appetite.
3. On further questioning, he says that he returned from his missionary trip to Brazil last week.
4. He is excited as he talks about his trip.
5. Besides a worthy clinical experience, he also enjoyed local outdoor activities, like swimming and rafting.
6. His past medical history is insignificant.
7. The blood pressure is
8. 120/70 mm
9. Hg, the pulse is 100/min, and the temperature is 38.3 C (100.9 F).
10. On examination, there is a rash on the legs.
11. Patient's symptoms are suspected to be due to hepatitis A.
12. The rest of the examination is normal.
error_sentence: Patient's symptoms are suspected to be due to hepatitis A.
corrected_sentence: Patient's symptoms are suspected to be due to Schistosoma mansoni.
corrected_text: A 29-year-old internal medicine resident presents to the emergency department with complaints of fevers, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and skin rash for 2 days. He feels fatigued and has lost his appetite. On further questioning, he says that he returned from his missionary trip to Brazil last week. He is excited as he talks about his trip. Besides a worthy clinical experience, he also enjoyed local outdoor activities, like swimming and rafting. His past medical history is insignificant. The blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg, the pulse is 100/min, and the temperature is 38.3 C (100.9 F). On examination, there is a rash on the legs. Patient's symptoms are suspected to be due to Schistosoma mansoni. The rest of the examination is normal.

sentences:
1. A 7-year-old boy is brought by his parents to his pediatrician with a one-day history of fever, chills, and pain in the right upper extremity.
2. The patient's mother says that he has injured his right index finger while playing in the garden 3 days earlier.
3. His temperature is 38.8 C (101.8 F), pulse is
4. 120/min, respiratory rate is 24/min, and
5. blood pressure is 102/70 mm
6. Hg.
7. On physical examination, there is an infected wound present on the tip of the right index finger.
8. Irregular and subcutaneous linear subcutaneous red streaks are seen on the ventral surface of the right forearm, which is warm and tender to palpation.
9. There is painful right infraclavicular lymphadenopathy present.
10. Staphylococcus aureus is the causative agent of the patient's condition.
error_sentence: Staphylococcus aureus is the causative agent of the patient's condition.
corrected_sentence: Group A beta-hemolytic Streptococcus is the causative agent of the patient's condition.

sentences:
1. A 42-year-old morbidly obese woman presents to the emergency room for evaluation of a rash that started 3 days ago.
2. The rash appeared under the patient's breasts as well as in the abdominal folds, and the patient describes it as being very itchy.
3. The rash is bright red with scaling and a few scattered purulent areas of skin breakdown.
4. The causative agent is an irregular, non-septate yeast with wide angles.
5. The patient is afebrile and is in no apparent distress, besides being uncomfortable from the itching.
error_sentence: The causative agent is an irregular, non-septate yeast with wide angles.
corrected_sentence: The causative agent is a commensal yeast that is catalase-positive.

The rash appeared under the patient's breasts as well as in the abdominal folds, and the patient describes it as being very itchy. The rash is bright red with scaling and a few scattered purulent areas of skin breakdown. The causative agent is a commensal yeast that is catalase-positive. The patient is afebrile and is in no apparent distress, besides being uncomfortable from the itching.

sentences:
1. A 4-year-old boy is brought to his pediatrician by his mother for a cough.
2. His mother reports that he has had a loud cough and hoarse voice for the past 3 days.
3. He also had a runny nose and mild fever last week.
4. He was born with Tetralogy of Fallot and underwent surgery as an infant.
5. He has been followed regularly by a pediatric cardiologist.
6. There are no other sick contacts in the household.
7. His temperature is 100.9 F (38.3 C), blood pressure is 105/65
8. mmHg, pulse is 110/min, and respirations are 24/min.
9. An anteroposterior radiograph of the neck is shown in Figure A. A lung radiograph is normal.
10. Respiratory syncytial virus is the causal pathogen of the patient's condition.
error_sentence: Respiratory syncytial virus is the causal pathogen of the patient's condition.
corrected_sentence: Parainfluenza is the causal pathogen of the patient's condition.
corrected_text: A 4-year-old boy is brought to his pediatrician by his mother for a cough. His mother reports that he has had a loud cough and hoarse voice for the past 3 days. He also had a runny nose and mild fever last week. He was born with Tetralogy of Fallot and underwent surgery as an infant. He has been followed regularly by a pediatric cardiologist. There are no other sick contacts in the household. His temperature is 100.9 F (38.3 C), blood pressure is 105/65 mmHg, pulse is 110/min, and respirations are 24/min. An anteroposterior radiograph of the neck is shown in Figure A. A lung radiograph is normal. Parainfluenza is the causal pathogen of the patient's condition.

sentences:
1. A 2-year-old male presents to the emergency department for fatigue and lethargy.
2. Upon presentation, the patient is found to be severely dehydrated.
3. The patient's mother says that he has been having non-bloody diarrhea for a day.
4. She also says that the patient has not received any vaccinations after 6 months and currently attends a daycare center.
5. Norovirus is suspected.
6. The responsible microbe is isolated and its structure is analyzed.
error_sentence: Norovirus is suspected.
corrected_sentence: Rotavirus is suspected.

The responsible microbe is isolated and its structure is analyzed.

sentences:
1. A 68-year-old woman presents to the emergency room with productive cough and fever.
2. She has a chronic cough that has been getting progressively worse over the last 2 weeks.
3. Last night she developed a fever and vomited.
4. She smoked one pack of cigarettes per day for 40 years and recently quit.
5. Her past medical history includes COPD and her medications include ipratropium and fluticasone.
6. On physical exam her temperature is 102.2 F (39 C), blood pressure is 131/78
7. mmHg, pulse is 110/min, respirations are 22/min, and oxygen saturation is 95% on room air.
8. She has decreased breath sounds bilaterally with diffuse crackles.
9. You obtain a sputum sample and identify an organism that grows selectively on medium containing factors
10. V and X. Streptococcus pneumoniae infection is suspected.
error_sentence: V and X. Streptococcus pneumoniae infection is suspected.
corrected_sentence: V and X. Haemophilus influenzae infection is suspected.
corrected_text: A 68-year-old woman presents to the emergency room with productive cough and fever. She has a chronic cough that has been getting progressively worse over the last 2 weeks. Last night she developed a fever and vomited. She smoked one pack of cigarettes per day for 40 years and recently quit. Her past medical history includes COPD and her medications include ipratropium and fluticasone. On physical exam her temperature is 102.2 F (39 C), blood pressure is 131/78 mmHg, pulse is 110/min, respirations are 22/min, and oxygen saturation is 95% on room air. She has decreased breath sounds bilaterally with diffuse crackles. You obtain a sputum sample and identify an organism that grows selectively on medium containing factors V and X. Haemophilus influenzae infection is suspected.

sentences:
1. A 14-year-old boy presents with abdominal pain and diarrhea after returning from an East Asian vacation.
2. Stool sample reveals the presence of red and white blood cells.
3. Stool culture shows growth of immobile, non-lactose fermenting gram-negative rods.
4. The attending physician explains to the medical students that Salmonella enteritidis functions by invading intestinal M-cells.

sentences:

2. Past medical history includes HIV infection diagnosed 10 years ago, managed with HAART.
3. He says he hasn't been compliant with his HAART therapy as prescribed because it is too expensive and he is currently unemployed without insurance.
4. A chest radiograph is performed and reveals a cavity in the right upper lobe of his lung.
5. Mycobacterium avian complex is suspected.

sentences:
1. A 29-year-old woman presents to her primary care doctor with a lesion on her left labia.
2. She first noticed the lesion 3 days ago.
3. The patient describes the lesion as painful and swollen.
4. She denies vaginal discharge.
5. Her past medical history is notable for mild intermittent asthma, gout, and obesity.
6. She uses an albuterol inhaler as needed and takes allopurinol.
7. She has had 5 sexual partners in the past year and uses the pull-out method for contraception.
8. She has a 10-pack-year smoking history and drinks 10-12 alcoholic beverages per week.
9. Patient is diagnosed with a herpes simplex virus type 2 infection when on exam, she has an ulcerated, tender, and purulent ulcer on the left labia majora.
10. The patient has mild unilateral painful inguinal lymphadenopathy.

sentences:
1. A 60-year-old man presents to the physician for a follow-up examination.
2. During the previous visit, splenomegaly was detected on the abdominal exam, which has been confirmed by abdominal ultrasound.
3. He has no complaints other than fatigue for several months.
4. There is no history of serious illness.
5. His only medication is acetaminophen for knee pain.
6. The temperature is 36.7 C (98.1 F ), pulse is 68, respirations are 12/min, and blood pressure is 125/70 mm
7. Hg.
8. On physical examination, the spleen size on percussion is 16 cm (6.2 in).
9. Otherwise, the physical examination shows no abnormalities.
10. The laboratory test results are as follows:
11. Hemoglobin 10 g
12. /dL Mean corpuscular volume 90
13. m3 Leukocyte count
14. 80,000/mm3 Platelet count 450,000/mm3
15. The peripheral blood smear shows a predominance of neutrophils and the presence of band cells, myelocytes, promyelocytes, and blasts (< 5%).
16. The cytogenetic study shows t(9;22).
17. The patient is diagnosed with classical Hodgkin's lymphoma.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with classical Hodgkin's lymphoma.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia.
corrected_text:
A 60-year-old man presents to the physician for a follow-up examination. During the previous visit, splenomegaly was detected on the abdominal exam, which has been confirmed by abdominal ultrasound. He has no complaints other than fatigue for several months. There is no history of serious illness. His only medication is acetaminophen for knee pain. The temperature is 36.7 C (98.1 F ), pulse is 68, respirations are 12/min, and blood pressure is 125/70 mm Hg. On physical examination, the spleen size on percussion is 16 cm (6.2 in). Otherwise, the physical examination shows no abnormalities. The laboratory test results are as follows:
Hemoglobin 10 g/dL
Mean corpuscular volume 90  m3
Leukocyte count 80,000/mm3
Platelet count 450,000/mm3
The peripheral blood smear shows a predominance of neutrophils and the presence of band cells, myelocytes, promyelocytes, and blasts (< 5%). The cytogenetic study shows t(9;22). The patient is diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia.

2. During the previous visit, splenomegaly was detected on the abdominal exam, which has been confirmed by abdominal ultrasound.
3. He has no complaints other than fatigue for several months.
4. There is no history of serious illness.
5. His only medication is acetaminophen for knee pain.
6. The temperature is 36.7 C (98.1 F ), pulse is 68, respirations are 12/min, and blood pressure is 125/70 mm
7. Hg.
8. On physical examination, the spleen size on percussion is 16 cm (6.2 in).
9. Otherwise, the physical examination shows no abnormalities.
10. The laboratory test results are as follows:
11. Hemoglobin 10 g
12. /dL Mean corpuscular volume 90
13. m3 Leukocyte count
14. 80,000/mm3 Platelet count 450,000/mm3
15. The patient is diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia after the peripheral blood smear shows a predominance of neutrophils and the presence of band cells, myelocytes, promyelocytes, and blasts (< 5%).
16. The cytogenetic study shows t(9;22).

metadata.original_text:
A 60-year-old man presents to the physician for a follow-up examination. During the previous visit, splenomegaly was detected on the abdominal exam, which has been confirmed by abdominal ultrasound. He has no complaints other than fatigue for several months. There is no history of serious illness. His only medication is acetaminophen for knee pain. The temperature is 36.7 C (98.1 F ), pulse is 68, respirations are 12/min, and blood pressure is 125/70 mm Hg. On physical examination, the spleen size on percussion is 16 cm (6.2 in). Otherwise, the physical examination shows no abnormalities. The laboratory test results are as follows:
Hemoglobin 10 g/dL
Mean corpuscular volume 90  m3
Leukocyte count 80,000/mm3
Platelet count 450,000/mm3
The patient is diagnosed with chronic myeloid leukemia after the peripheral blood smear shows a predominance of neutrophils and the presence of band cells, myelocytes, promyelocytes, and blasts (< 5%). The cytogenetic study shows t(9;22).

15 The cytogenetic study shows t(9;22).

sentences:
1. A 43-year-old woman with suspected trigeminal cephalgia presents to the neurology clinic in significant pain.
2. She reports a sharp, stabbing electric-like pain on the right side of her face.
3. The pain started suddenly 2 weeks ago.
4. The pain is so excruciating that she can no longer laugh, speak, or eat her meals as these activities cause episodes of pain.
5. She had to miss work last week as a result.
6. Her attacks last about 3 minutes and go away when she goes to sleep.
7. She typically has 2-3 attacks per day now.
8. The vital signs include: blood pressure 132/84
9. mm
10. Hg, heart rate 79/min, and respiratory rate 14/min.
11. A neurological examination shows no loss of crude touch, tactile touch, or pain sensations on the left side of the face.
12. The pupillary light and accommodation reflexes are normal.
13. There is no drooping of her mouth, ptosis, or anhidrosis noted.
error_sentence: A 43-year-old woman with suspected trigeminal cephalgia presents to the neurology clinic in significant pain.
corrected_sentence: A 43-year-old woman with suspected trigeminal neuralgia presents to the neurology clinic in significant pain.

Her attacks last about 3 minutes and go away when she goes to sleep. She typically has 2-3 attacks per day now. The vital signs include: blood pressure 132/84 mm Hg, heart rate 79/min, and respiratory rate 14/min. A neurological examination shows no loss of crude touch, tactile touch, or pain sensations on the left side of the face. The pupillary light and accommodation reflexes are normal. There is no drooping of her mouth, ptosis, or anhidrosis noted.

sentences:
1. A 35-year-old woman comes to the clinic with complaints of joint pain and stiffness for the past few months.
2. Her hands, lower back, and left knee are involved and associated with morning stiffness that improves throughout the day with activities.
3. She also complains that her fingers change color upon exposure to cold.
4. She has also noticed a tightening of the skin on her face and thinning of her lips.
5. She feels tired throughout the day and has taken over-the-counter multivitamins that do not seem to help her much.
6. The patient does not smoke cigarettes and drinks alcohol socially.
7. She was diagnosed with hypertension 1 year ago and has been taking hydralazine for the past year.
8. She lost her parents in a road traffic accident 3 years ago.
9. Temperature is 36.7 C (98 F), blood pressure is 140/85 mm
10. Hg, pulse is 72/min, respirations are 12/min, and BMI is 25 kg/m2.
11. Her skin appears shiny and slightly thickened, especially her face and hands.
12. Laboratory investigation:
13. Complete blood count
14. Hemoglobin 9.5 g
15. /dl Leucocytes 5,500/mm3 Platelets
16. 150,000/mm3 ANA positive
17. Anti-centromere Antibody negative
18. Anti Scl-70 positive
19. Anti Jo-1 negative Anti-histone negative
20. Anti DsDNA negative
21. Limited cutaneous systemic scleroderma is suspected.
error_sentence: Limited cutaneous systemic scleroderma is suspected.
corrected_sentence: Diffuse cutaneous systemic scleroderma is suspected.
corrected_text:
A 35-year-old woman comes to the clinic with complaints of joint pain and stiffness for the past few months. Her hands, lower back, and left knee are involved and associated with morning stiffness that improves throughout the day with activities. She also complains that her fingers change color upon exposure to cold. She has also noticed a tightening of the skin on her face and thinning of her lips. She feels tired throughout the day and has taken over-the-counter multivitamins that do not seem to help her much. The patient does not smoke cigarettes and drinks alcohol socially. She was diagnosed with hypertension 1 year ago and has been taking hydralazine for the past year. She lost her parents in a road traffic accident 3 years ago. Temperature is 36.7 C (98 F), blood pressure is 140/85 mm Hg, pulse is 72/min, respirations are 12/min, and BMI is 25 kg/m2. Her skin appears shiny and slightly thickened, especially her face and hands.
Laboratory investigation:
Complete blood count
Hemoglobin 9.5 g/dl
Leucocytes 5,500/mm3
Platelets 150,000/mm3
ANA positive
Anti-centromere Antibody negative
Anti Scl-70 positive
Anti Jo-1 negative
Anti-histone negative
Anti DsDNA negative
Diffuse cutaneous systemic scleroderma is suspected.

sentences:
1. A 33-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with weakness.
2. She states that at the end of the day she feels so fatigued and weak that she can hardly care for herself.
3. She currently feels this way.
4. The patient has had multiple illnesses recently and has been traveling, hiking, and camping.
5. Her temperature is 98.0 F (36.7 C), blood pressure is 124/84
6. mmHg, pulse is 82/min, respirations are 12/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air.
7. Patient is diagnosed with Guillain-Barre syndrome after physical exam is notable for 2/5 strength of the upper extremities and 4/5 strength of the lower extremities.
8. Visual exam is notable for mild diplopia.

sentences:
1. A patient with a known spinal cord ependymoma presents to his neurologist for a check up.
2. He complains that he has had difficulty walking, which he attributes to left leg weakness.
3. On exam, he is noted to have 1/5 strength in his left lower extremity, as well as decreased vibration and position sensation in the left lower extremity and decreased pain and temperature sensation in the right lower extremity.
4. Patient is diagnosed with right-sided Brown-Sequard (hemisection).
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with right-sided Brown-Sequard (hemisection).
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with left-sided Brown-Sequard (hemisection).

Patient is diagnosed with left-sided Brown-Sequard (hemisection).

sentences:
1. A young Mediterranean teen brings her 4-year-old little brother to the Emergency Room because of a high temperature.
2. Their parents are on their way to the hospital, but, in the meantime, she provides some of the history.
3. She explains that he has been running a fever and limping for the past week.
4. This morning, she had trouble awakening him, and she noticed some swelling and redness around his right ankle.
5. In terms of his past medical history, she knows he has something wrong with his blood.
6. He had to receive extra vaccinations as an infant, and he takes an antibiotic everyday.
7. On exam in the ED, his temperature is 102.4 deg F (39.1 deg C), blood pressure is 90/60
8. mmHg, pulse is 123/min, and respirations are 22/min.
9. He is lethargic, and is diagnosed with thrombophlebitis after his exam is noteworthy for erythema and edema in an area surrounding his distal shin.

corrected_sentence: He is lethargic, and is diagnosed with osteomyelitis after his exam is noteworthy for erythema and edema in an area surrounding his distal shin.

This morning, she had trouble awakening him, and she noticed some swelling and redness around his right ankle. In terms of his past medical history, she knows he has something wrong with his blood. He had to receive extra vaccinations as an infant, and he takes an antibiotic everyday. On exam in the ED, his temperature is 102.4 deg F (39.1 deg C), blood pressure is 90/60 mmHg, pulse is 123/min, and respirations are 22/min. He is lethargic, and is diagnosed with osteomyelitis after his exam is noteworthy for erythema and edema in an area surrounding his distal shin.

sentences:
1. A 45-year-old woman repetitively visits the general surgery clinic worried that her inguinal hernia is incarcerated.
2. 2 months ago, she was seen in the emergency department where she presented with a left lower abdominal swelling.
3. The mass was easily reduced and the patient was referred to the general surgery clinic for elective surgical repair.
4. Because her condition was deemed not urgent, she was informed that she was down on the surgical waiting list.
5. Despite this, she continues to visit the clinic and the ED worried that her bowels are 'trapped
6. and dying.' Each time she is reassured and any protrusion present is quickly reduced.
7. She has previously frequently visited her primary care physician for complaints of abdominal pain and inconsistent bowel habits, but no etiology could be identified.
8. She continues to intermittently have these symptoms and spends hours every day worrying about what may be going on.
9. Patient is diagnosed with illness anxiety disorder.
10. She has no other significant past medical history.

sentences:
1. A 13-year-old girl is brought to the pediatrician due to a 4-month history of heavy vaginal bleeding during menstrual periods.
2. She endorses episodes of bleeding gums after brushing her teeth and experienced prolonged bleeding after tonsillectomy 6 years ago.
3. Her mother states that she bled significantly during childbirth and that the girl's older brother has similar symptoms including easy bruising.
4. Vitals were stable and physical exam was not revealing.
5. Laboratory studies show:
6. Platelet count:
7. 72,000/mm^3
8. Bleeding time:
9. 14 min
10. Prothrombin time: 12 secs (INR = 1)
11. Partial thromboplastin time:
12. 40 secs
13. Blood smear demonstrates increased megakaryocytes and enlarged platelets.
14. Platelets do not aggregate to ristocetin.
15. The patient is diagnosed with Glanzmann thrombasthenia.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with Glanzmann thrombasthenia.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with Bernard-Soulier syndrome.
corrected_text:
A 13-year-old girl is brought to the pediatrician due to a 4-month history of heavy vaginal bleeding during menstrual periods. She endorses episodes of bleeding gums after brushing her teeth and experienced prolonged bleeding after tonsillectomy 6 years ago. Her mother states that she bled significantly during childbirth and that the girl's older brother has similar symptoms including easy bruising. Vitals were stable and physical exam was not revealing. Laboratory studies show:

Platelet count: 72,000/mm^3
Bleeding time: 14 min
Prothrombin time: 12 secs (INR = 1)
Partial thromboplastin time: 40 secs

Blood smear demonstrates increased megakaryocytes and enlarged platelets. Platelets do not aggregate to ristocetin. The patient is diagnosed with Bernard-Soulier syndrome.

sentences:
1. A 30-year-old patient comes to the emergency room with a chief complaint of left chest pain and a productive cough with purulent sputum for 1 week.
2. He also complains of shortness of breath.
3. He said he had been previously diagnosed with influenza but did not follow the doctor's instructions.
4. His vitals include: heart rate 70/min, respiratory rate 22/min, temperature 38.7 C (
5. 101.7 F), blood pressure
6. 120/60 mm
7. Hg, and SO2 80%.
8. The differential diagnosis includes histoplasmosis.
9. His hemogram and chest X-ray findings are as follows:
10. Hemoglobin 14 mg/dL
11. Hematocrit 45%
12. Leukocyte count 12,000/mm3 Neutrophils 82%
13. Lymphocytes 15%
14. Monocytes 3%
15. Platelet count 270,000/mm3 Chest X-ray alveolar infiltrates in the left base with air bronchograms
error_sentence: The differential diagnosis includes histoplasmosis.
corrected_sentence: The differential diagnosis includes pneumonia.

His hemogram and chest X-ray findings are as follows:

Hematocrit 45%
Leukocyte count 12,000/mm3
Neutrophils 82%
Lymphocytes 15%
Monocytes 3%
Platelet count 270,000/mm3
Chest X-ray alveolar infiltrates in the left base with air bronchograms

4. Chart review reveals a remote history of cigarette smoking as a teenager and Hepatitis B seropositivity.
5. The patient is diagnosed with microscopic polyangiitis.

sentences:
1. A 35-year-old woman with a history of Crohn disease presents for a follow-up appointment.
2. She says that lately, she has started to notice difficulty walking.
3. She says that some of her friends have joked that she appears to be walking as if she was drunk.
4. Past medical history is significant for Crohn disease
5. diagnosed 2 years ago, managed with natalizumab for the past year because her intestinal symptoms have become severe and unresponsive to other therapies.
6. On physical examination, there is gait and limb ataxia present.
7. Strength is 4/5 in the right upper limb.
8. Patient is diagnosed with Sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD) after a T1/T2 MRI of the brain is ordered and is shown.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with Sporadic Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (sCJD) after a T1/T2 MRI of the brain is ordered and is shown.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with progressive multifocal encephalopathy (PML) after a T1/T2 MRI of the brain is ordered and is shown.

She says that some of her friends have joked that she appears to be walking as if she was drunk. Past medical history is significant for Crohn disease diagnosed 2 years ago, managed with natalizumab for the past year because her intestinal symptoms have become severe and unresponsive to other therapies. On physical examination, there is gait and limb ataxia present. Strength is 4/5 in the right upper limb. Patient is diagnosed with progressive multifocal encephalopathy (PML) after a T1/T2 MRI of the brain is ordered and is shown.

8. A T1/T2 MRI of the brain is ordered and is shown.
9. The patient is diagnosed with progressive multifocal encephalopathy (PML).

sentences:
1. A 10-year-old girl with previously diagnosed sickle cell anemia presents to the emergency room with a low-grade fever, malaise, petechiae on her arms, and a rash on her face.
2. She regularly takes hydroxyurea and receives blood transfusions to treat her condition.
3. Her blood tests show a hemoglobin of 4.0 g/dL, MCV of 87 fl, and 2% reticulocyte count.
4. An attempted bone marrow biopsy was  a dry, empty tap.
5. Patient is diagnosed with anermia of chronic disease.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with anermia of chronic disease.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with aplastic crisis.

sentences:
1. A 10-year-old boy is brought to the pediatrician by his mother for evaluation.
2. Last night, he was playing with his younger brother and a hot cup of coffee fell on his left shoulder.
3. Though his skin became red and swollen, he acted as if nothing happened and did not complain of pain or discomfort.
4. He has met all expected developmental milestones, and his vaccinations are up-to-date.
5. Physical examination reveals a normal appearing boy with height and weight in the 56th and 64th percentiles for his age, respectively.
6. The skin over his left shoulder is erythematous and swollen.
7. Patient is diagnosed with spina bifida oculta after sensory examination reveals impaired pain and temperature sensation in a cape-like distribution across both shoulders, arms, and neck.
8. The light touch, vibration, and position senses are preserved.
9. The motor examination is within normal limits, and he has no signs of a cerebellar lesion.
10. His gait is normal.

sentences:
1. A 26-year-old man presents to the office complaining of persistent epigastric pain for the past 2 months.
2. He states that his pain is worse a few hours after he eats.
3. His father had similar symptoms.
4. Past medical history is insignificant.
5. He is a non-smoker and does not drink alcohol.
6. The vital signs include blood pressure
7. 120/90 mm
8. Hg, heart rate 83/min, and temperature
9. 37.0 C (98.6 F).
10. Physical examination is insignificant except for mild epigastric tenderness.
11. A metabolic panel reveals the following:
12. Serum sodium 136 mEq/
13. L Serum potassium 4.2 mEq/
14. L Calcium 13.2 mg/dL
15. Bicarbonate 26 mEq/L Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals multiple duodenal ulcers.
16. Patient is diagnosed with gastric adenocarcinoma, intestinal type.

corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with MEN1.

sentences:
1. A 31-year-old man with suspected social anxiety disorder is brought in to the clinic by his sister because she is concerned about his behavior since the death of their mother 2 months ago.
2. The patient's sister states that he has always been a 'loner' and preferred being by himself than socializing with others.
3. His social isolation resulted in him being 'socially awkward', as described by his family.
4. However, 2 months ago, when he found out about the death of their mother, he showed little emotion and attended her funeral in jeans and a dirty T-shirt which upset the rest of their family.
5. When asked about it, he shrugged and said he was in a hurry to get to the funeral and 'just left the house with what I had on.'
6. He does not speak much during the interview, allowing his sister to speak on his behalf.
7. His sister insists that he has 'always
8. been like this', quiet and a complacent child who had no interest in playing with other children.
9. The patient currently lives alone and spends his time repairing and building electrical appliances, and his sister is worried that his self-imposed isolation is making it 'impossible
10. for him to interact with other people normally'.
error_sentence: A 31-year-old man with suspected social anxiety disorder is brought in to the clinic by his sister because she is concerned about his behavior since the death of their mother 2 months ago.

He does not speak much during the interview, allowing his sister to speak on his behalf. The patient currently lives alone and spends his time repairing and building electrical appliances, and his sister is worried that his self-imposed isolation is making it 'impossible for him to interact with other people normally'.

sentences:
1. A 62-year-old man comes to the office complaining of dysphagia that started 4-5 months ago.
2. He reports that he initially he had difficulty swallowing only solid foods.
3. More recently, he has noticed some trouble swallowing liquids.
4. The patient also complains of fatigue, a chronic cough that worsens at night, and burning chest pain that occurs after he eats.
5. He says that he has used over-the-counter antacids for 'years' with mild relief.
6. He denies any change in diet, but says he has 'gone down a pant size or 2.'
7. The patient has hypertension and hyperlipidemia.
8. He takes amlodipine and atorvastatin.
9. He smoked 1 pack of cigarettes a day for 12 years while in the military but quit 35 years ago.
10. He drinks 1-2 beers on the weekend while he is golfing with his friends.
11. His diet consists mostly of pasta, pizza, and steak.
12. The patient's temperature is 98 F (36.7 C), blood pressure is 143/91
13. mmHg, and pulse is 80/min.
14. His BMI is 32 kg/m^2.
15. Physical examination reveals an obese man in no acute distress.
16. No masses or enlarged lymph nodes are appreciated upon palpation of the neck.
17. Cardiopulmonary examination is unremarkable.
18. An endoscopy is performed, which identifies a lower esophageal mass.
19. Squamous cell carcinoma is suspected.
error_sentence: Squamous cell carcinoma is suspected.
corrected_sentence: Adenocarcinoma is suspected.

The patient has hypertension and hyperlipidemia. He takes amlodipine and atorvastatin. He smoked 1 pack of cigarettes a day for 12 years while in the military but quit 35 years ago. He drinks 1-2 beers on the weekend while he is golfing with his friends. His diet consists mostly of pasta, pizza, and steak. No masses or enlarged lymph nodes are appreciated upon palpation of the neck. Cardiopulmonary examination is unremarkable. An endoscopy is performed, which identifies a lower esophageal mass. Adenocarcinoma is suspected.

sentences:
1. A 74-year-old woman with a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and type
2. 2 diabetes mellitus is brought to her primary care doctor by her son who is concerned about the patient's ability to manage her activities of daily living.
3. She has been living alone since her husband passed away 2 years ago.
4. She has remained an active member of her retirement community's wine club; however, she stopped attending the meetings 3 weeks ago.
5. She is generally able to her maintain her house, but her house appears more disorganized over the past 2 weeks.
6. She generally drives short distances but avoids driving long distances as she occasionally gets lost when navigating new areas.
7. She feels like her balance is getting worse, but she has not fallen.
8. She has noticed increased urinary urgency over the past 8 months and has had 2 episodes of incontinence.
9. Despite these changes, she reports feeling well.
10. She drinks 4-6 glasses of wine per day.
11. She was started on multiple medications for worsening anxiety by her psychiatrist 1 month ago.
12. Her BMI is 31 kg/m^2.
13. Her temperature is 99.8 F (37.7 C), blood pressure is 115/65
14. mmHg, pulse is 95/min, and respirations are 17/min.
15. On examination, she is oriented to person and time but not place or situation.
16. She does not seem to recognize her doctor despite knowing him for many years.
17. She becomes somnolent intermittently throughout the interview.
18. The patient is diagnosed with Alzheimer dementia after she can recall 0/3 words after 5 minutes.
19. She has a low-frequency tremor in her right arm that increases in severity with deliberate movement.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with Alzheimer dementia after she can recall 0/3 words after 5 minutes.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with delirium after she can recall 0/3 words after 5 minutes.

She has been living alone since her husband passed away 2 years ago. She has remained an active member of her retirement community's wine club; however, she stopped attending the meetings 3 weeks ago. She is generally able to her maintain her house, but her house appears more disorganized over the past 2 weeks. She generally drives short distances but avoids driving long distances as she occasionally gets lost when navigating new areas. She feels like her balance is getting worse, but she has not fallen. She has noticed increased urinary urgency over the past 8 months and has had 2 episodes of incontinence. Despite these changes, she reports feeling well. She drinks 4-6 glasses of wine per day. She was started on multiple medications for worsening anxiety by her psychiatrist 1 month ago. Her BMI is 31 kg/m^2. Her temperature is 99.8 F (37.7 C), blood pressure is 115/65 mmHg, pulse is 95/min, and respirations are 17/min. On examination, she is oriented to person and time but not place or situation. She does not seem to recognize her doctor despite knowing him for many years. She becomes somnolent intermittently throughout the interview. The patient is diagnosed with delirium after she can recall 0/3 words after 5 minutes. She has a low-frequency tremor in her right arm that increases in severity with deliberate movement.

sentences:
1. An 82-year-old woman presents to the emergency department because of excruciating right flank pain and fever for the past 2 days.
2. She states that she is having trouble urinating.
3. Her past medical history is unremarkable.
4. A urinalysis is performed and comes back positive for leukocytes and gram-negative bacilli.
5. A contrast computed tomography of the abdomen is performed and reveals a large retroperitoneal mass compressing the right ureter, leading to hydronephrosis of the right kidney.
6. The mass is excised.
7. Histopathologic evaluation of the mass is shown in the image below, and it is determined to be malignant.
8. The patient is diagnosed with lipoma.

sentences:
1. A 13-year-old boy re-presents to his pediatrician with a new onset rash that began a few days after his initial visit.
2. He initially presented with complaints of sore throat but was found to have a negative strep test.
3. His mother demanded that he be placed on antibiotics, but this was refused by his pediatrician.
4. The boy's father, a neurologist, therefore, started him on penicillin.
5. Shortly after starting the drug, the boy developed a fever and a rash.
6. The patient is admitted and his symptoms worsen.
7. The patient is diagnosed with Stevens-Johnson Syndrome.
8. His skin begins to slough off, and the rash covers over 30% of his body.
9. His oropharynx and corneal membranes are also affected.
10. You examine him at the bedside and note a positive Nikolsky's sign.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with Stevens-Johnson Syndrome.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with toxic epidermal necrolysis.

The boy's father, a neurologist, therefore, started him on penicillin. Shortly after starting the drug, the boy developed a fever and a rash. The patient is admitted and his symptoms worsen. The patient is diagnosed with toxic epidermal necrolysis. His skin begins to slough off, and the rash covers over 30% of his body. His oropharynx and corneal membranes are also affected. You examine him at the bedside and note a positive Nikolsky's sign.

sentences:
1. A 57-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department by her husband with complaints of sudden-onset slurring for the past hour.
2. She is also having difficulty holding things with her right hand.
3. She denies fever, head trauma, diplopia, vertigo, walking difficulties, nausea, and vomiting.
4. Past medical history is significant for type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia for which she takes a baby aspirin, metformin, ramipril, and simvastatin.
5. She has a 23-pack-year cigarette smoking history.
6. Her blood pressure is
7. 148/96 mm
8. Hg, the heart rate is 84/min, and the temperature is 37.1 C (98.8 F).
9. On physical examination, extraocular movements are intact.
10. The patient is dysarthric, but her higher mental functions are intact.
11. There is a right-sided facial weakness with preserved forehead wrinkling.
12. Her gag reflex is weak.
13. Muscle strength is mildly reduced in the right hand.
14. She has difficulty performing skilled movements with her right hand, especially writing, and has difficulty touching far objects with her index finger.
15. She is able to walk without difficulty.
16. Pinprick and proprioception sensation is intact.
17. A head CT scan is within normal limits.
18. The patient is diagnosed with pure motor syndrome.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with pure motor syndrome.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with dysarthia-clumsy hand syndrome.

sentences:
1. A 65-year-old man presents with pain in his left thigh for a week.
2. He describes the pain as dull and constant, boring in nature, and localized deep below the thigh muscle.
3. He says it is worse at night.
4. Physical examination is significant for tenderness and warmth over the anterior aspect of the left thigh.
5. A plain radiograph of the left femur shows increased cortical thickness with widened intercortical space.
6. Laboratory studies show: Alkaline phosphatase 925 U/L Serum calcium
7. 9.2 mg/dL
8. Serum phosphorus 4.4 mg/dL
9. Findings on bone biopsy are shown in the image.
10. Patient is diagnosed with osteitis fibrosa cystica.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with osteitis fibrosa cystica.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with osteitis deformans.
corrected_text:
A 65-year-old man presents with pain in his left thigh for a week. He describes the pain as dull and constant, boring in nature, and localized deep below the thigh muscle. He says it is worse at night. Physical examination is significant for tenderness and warmth over the anterior aspect of the left thigh. A plain radiograph of the left femur shows increased cortical thickness with widened intercortical space. Laboratory studies show:
Alkaline phosphatase
925 U/L
Serum calcium
9.2 mg/dL
Serum phosphorus 4.4 mg/dL
Findings on bone biopsy are shown in the image. Patient is diagnosed with osteitis deformans.

sentences:
1. A 29-year-old man comes into his primary care physician's office with a chief complaint of a cough.
2. The patient states that the cough started yesterday and he is asking if he needs antibiotics.
3. While conversing with the patient, you note that he seems cold, mistrustful, and does not display much emotion.
4. The patient worked for a software company but recently took a different position that allows him to work from home.
5. The patient states that he switched positions because while at the office he made a mistake during a presentation.
6. He felt that afterwards, his fellow workers thought less of him and he was embarrassed to show his face around the office.
7. The patient wishes he could have related better to his coworkers.
8. He currently lives in a barn on the outskirts of town with his many cats.
9. On physical exam you note a healthy young man, adorned in overalls and denim shoes.
10. The patient behavior is suspicious for schizotypal personality disorder.
11. His physical exam is notable for erythema of the posterior pharynx.
12. The patient is informed that he has a viral upper respiratory infection and is sent home with instructions to rest and hydrate himself.
error_sentence: The patient behavior is suspicious for schizotypal personality disorder.
corrected_sentence: The patient behavior is suspicious for avoidant personality disorder.

He felt that afterwards, his fellow workers thought less of him and he was embarrassed to show his face around the office. The patient wishes he could have related better to his coworkers. He currently lives in a barn on the outskirts of town with his many cats. On physical exam you note a healthy young man, adorned in overalls and denim shoes. The patient behavior is suspicious for avoidant personality disorder. His physical exam is notable for erythema of the posterior pharynx. The patient is informed that he has a viral upper respiratory infection and is sent home with instructions to rest and hydrate himself.

7. mmHg, pulse is

corrected_text:
A 61-year-old woman presents to the urgent care unit with a 2-week history of abdominal pain after meals. The patient reports vomiting over the past few days. The past medical history is significant for osteoarthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus. She regularly drinks alcohol. She does not smoke cigarettes. The patient currently presents with vital signs within normal limits. On physical examination, the patient appears to be in moderate distress, but she is alert and oriented. The palpation of the abdomen elicits tenderness in the epigastric region. The CT of the abdomen shows no signs of an acute process. The laboratory results are listed below.
Na+ 139 mEq/L
K+ 4.4 mEq/L
Cl- 109 mmol/L

metadata.original_text:
A 61-year-old woman presents to the urgent care unit with a 2-week history of abdominal pain after meals. The patient reports vomiting over the past few days. The past medical history is significant for osteoarthritis and systemic lupus erythematosus. She regularly drinks alcohol. She does not smoke cigarettes. The patient currently presents with vital signs within normal limits. On physical examination, the patient appears to be in moderate distress, but she is alert and oriented. The palpation of the abdomen elicits tenderness in the epigastric region. The CT of the abdomen shows no signs of an acute process. The laboratory results are listed below.

Gastric ulcer is suspected.

sentences:
1. A 13-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with respiratory distress, fever, and a productive cough.
2. Past medical history is significant for a history of recurrent bronchopneumonia since the age of 5, managed conservatively with antibiotics and mucolytic therapy.
3. The patient's weight was normal at birth, but he suffered from a failure to thrive, although there was no neonatal history of chronic diarrhea or jaundice.
4. His current vitals are a respiratory rate of 26/min, a pulse of 96/min, a temperature of 38.8 C (101.8 F), a blood pressure of
5. 90/60 mm
6. Hg, and oxygen saturation of 88% on room air.
7. On physical examination, there is coarse crepitus bilaterally and both expiratory and inspiratory wheezing is present.
8. The chest radiograph shows evidence of diffuse emphysema.
9. A sweat chloride test and nitro tetrazolium test are both within normal limits.
10. A complete blood count is significant for the following: WBC 26300
11. /mm3
12. Neutrophils 62%
13. Lymphocytes 36%
14. Eosinophils 2%
15. Total bilirubin
16. 0.8 mg/dL
17. Direct bilirubin
18. 0.2 mg/dL
19. SGOT 100
20. U/L SGPT 120
21. U/L
22. ALP
23. 200 U/L Results of serum protein electrophoresis are shown in the figure.
24. Patient is diagnosed with cystic fibrosis.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with cystic fibrosis.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency.
corrected_text:
A 13-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department with respiratory distress, fever, and a productive cough. Past medical history is significant for a history of recurrent bronchopneumonia since the age of 5, managed conservatively with antibiotics and mucolytic therapy. The patient's weight was normal at birth, but he suffered from a failure to thrive, although there was no neonatal history of chronic diarrhea or jaundice. His current vitals are a respiratory rate of 26/min, a pulse of 96/min, a temperature of 38.8 C (101.8 F), a blood pressure of 90/60 mm Hg, and oxygen saturation of 88% on room air. On physical examination, there is coarse crepitus bilaterally and both expiratory and inspiratory wheezing is present. The chest radiograph shows evidence of diffuse emphysema. A sweat chloride test and nitro tetrazolium test are both within normal limits. A complete blood count is significant for the following:
WBC 26300/mm3
Neutrophils 62%
Lymphocytes 36%
Eosinophils 2%
Total bilirubin 0.8 mg/dL
Direct bilirubin 0.2 mg/dL
SGOT 100 U/L
SGPT 120 U/L
ALP 200 U/L
Results of serum protein electrophoresis are shown in the figure. Patient is diagnosed with alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency.

sentences:
1. An 11-year-old girl is brought to her primary care physician by her mother with complaints of constant lower abdominal pain and foul-smelling urine for the past 2 days.
2. The patient has had several previous episodes of simple urinary tract infections in the past.
3. Her vitals signs show mild tachycardia without fever.
4. Physical examination reveals suprapubic tenderness without costovertebral angle tenderness on percussion.
5. Urinalysis reveals positive leukocyte esterase and nitrite.
6. Further questioning reveals that the patient does not use the school toilets and holds her urine all day until she gets home.
7. When pressed further, she gets teary-eyed and starts to cry and complains that other girls will make fun of her if she uses the bathroom and will spread rumors to the teachers and her friends.
8. Patient is diagnosed with social phobia performance after she reports that though this has never happened in the past it concerns her a great deal.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with social phobia performance after she reports that though this has never happened in the past it concerns her a great deal.

sentences:
1. A 32-year-old man comes to the office complaining of right-sided upper abdominal pain for about 2 weeks.
2. He is also complaining of subjective fever and malaise for the same duration.
3. He has never been out of the United States.
4. Additionally, he describes several episodes of bloody diarrhea and crampy abdominal pain that resolved on their own a few months ago.
5. Travel history is noncontributory.
6. He has been sexually active with 3 male partners in the last year and uses a condom inconsistently.
7. He was diagnosed with syphilis 4 months ago and was treated with a single shot of penicillin.
8. He has smoked 1 pack of cigarettes per day for the last 10 years and drinks 1-2 beers a day.
9. Temperature is 38.7 C (101.6 F), blood pressure is 137/78 mm
10. Hg, pulse is 98/min, respirations are 14/min, and BMI is 22 kg/m2.
11. On physical examination, his liver is tender and palpable 2 cm below the right costal margin.
12. Laboratory test Hemoglobin
13. 15 g/dL
14. Leucocyte and differential  Leucocyte count  12,500
15. /mm3 Neutrophil
16. 60%
17. Lymphocyte  31%
18. Eosinophil  1%
19. Liver function
20. test ALT   100
21. U/L AST
22. 95 U/L
23. ALP 220
24. U/L CT scan of the abdomen shows a single cystic lesion on the right lobe of the liver.
25. Patient is diagnosed with a pyogenic liver abscess.

sentences:
1. An 8-year-old boy presents with a limp favoring his right leg.
2. The patient's mother noticed he had been limping without complaint for the past 6 months.
3. Past medical history is significant for the flu last year.
4. No current medications.
5. All immunizations are up to date.
6. The vital signs include: temperature 37.0 C (98.6 F), blood pressure
7. 100/60
8. mm
9. Hg, pulse
10. 74/min, respiratory rate 19/min, and oxygen saturation 99% on room air.
11. The body mass index (BMI) is 17.2 kg/m2.
12. On physical examination, the patient is alert and cooperative.
13. Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is suspected after examination.
14. A limp favoring the right leg is noted when the patient is walking.
15. There is mild tenderness on deep palpation of the left lumbar region but no erythema, edema, or warmth.
16. There is a decreased range of motion of the left hip.
error_sentence: Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is suspected after examination.
corrected_sentence: Legg-Calve-Perthes disease is suspected after examination.

Past medical history is significant for the flu last year. No current medications. All immunizations are up to date. The vital signs include: temperature 37.0 C (98.6 F), blood pressure 100/60 mm Hg, pulse 74/min, respiratory rate 19/min, and oxygen saturation 99% on room air. The body mass index (BMI) is 17.2 kg/m2. On physical examination, the patient is alert and cooperative. Legg-Calve-Perthes disease is suspected after examination. A limp favoring the right leg is noted when the patient is walking. There is mild tenderness on deep palpation of the left lumbar region but no erythema, edema, or warmth. There is a decreased range of motion of the left hip.

sentences:
1. A 45-year-old woman presents to the clinic complaining of weakness that has progressively worsened over the past 2 weeks.
2. She states that she has a hard time lifting both her arms but that they function normally.
3. She notes no history of trauma or other deficits.
4. On examination, that patient has 2/5 muscle strength on shoulder shrug and arm abduction bilaterally, but all other neurological exam findings are normal.
5. You notice some skin changes and ask the patient about them.
6. She states that she has had a rash around her eyes as well as on her lower face, going down to her neck and chest.
7. She notes that the rashes started around the same time as the weakness began.
8. Labs are drawn and a complete blood count and basic metabolic panel are normal.
9. Patient is diagnosed with myasthenia gravis.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with myasthenia gravis.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with dermatomyositis.

She notes that the rashes started around the same time as the weakness began. Labs are drawn and a complete blood count and basic metabolic panel are normal. Patient is diagnosed with dermatomyositis.

sentences:
1. A 24-year-old woman presents to her gynecologist complaining of mild pelvic discomfort and a frothy, yellowish discharge from her vagina for the past 2 weeks.
2. She also complains of pain during sexual intercourse and sometimes after urination.
3. Her past medical history is noncontributory.
4. She takes oral contraceptives and a multivitamin daily.
5. She has had two male sexual partners in her lifetime and uses condoms inconsistently.
6. Today, her vitals are normal.
7. Patient is diagnosed with bacterial vaginosis after her pelvic exam, she has vulvovaginal erythema and a 'strawberry cervix' that is tender to motion, with minimal green-yellow malodorous discharge.
8. A swab of the vaginal wall is analyzed for pH at bedside.
9. Vaginal pH is 5.8.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with bacterial vaginosis after her pelvic exam, she has vulvovaginal erythema and a 'strawberry cervix' that is tender to motion, with minimal green-yellow malodorous discharge.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with trichomoniasis after her pelvic exam, she has vulvovaginal erythema and a 'strawberry cervix' that is tender to motion, with minimal green-yellow malodorous discharge.
corrected_text: A 24-year-old woman presents to her gynecologist complaining of mild pelvic discomfort and a frothy, yellowish discharge from her vagina for the past 2 weeks. She also complains of pain during sexual intercourse and sometimes after urination. Her past medical history is noncontributory. She takes oral contraceptives and a multivitamin daily. She has had two male sexual partners in her lifetime and uses condoms inconsistently. Today, her vitals are normal. sentences:

sentences:
1. A 20-year-old man presents with a painless neck mass that has gradually increased in size.
2. The mass is anteromedial to the right sternocleidomastoid muscle and has been present for 3 years.
3. The mass increased in size and became more tender following an upper respiratory infection.
4. An ultrasound of the neck identifies a single, round cystic mass with uniform, low echogenicity, and no internal septations.
5. A contrast-enhanced CT scan of the neck shows a homogeneous mass with low attenuation centrally and with smooth rim enhancement.
6. Patient is diagnosed with a first branchial cleft cyst.

sentences:
1. A 4-year-old girl presents to the office with her parents who are concerned about their daughter and slow, progressive changes in her behavior.
2. The girl was born at 39 weeks gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery.
3. She is up to date on all vaccines and was meeting all developmental milestones until about 2 years ago.
4. At one point she had a vocabulary of several words and now she verbalizes in grunts.
5. She also flaps her hands in a repeated motion and has difficulty walking.
6. Her parents have tried several home therapies to improve their daughter's symptoms including restricted diets, hydrotherapy, and a variety of nutritional supplements.
7. The vital signs include: heart rate
8. 90/min, respiratory rate 22/min, blood pressure 110/65
9. mm
10. Hg, and temperature 36.9 C (98.4 F).
11. On physical exam, she is well nourished and stares absently out the window.
12. Her heart has a regular rate and rhythm and her lungs are clear to auscultation bilaterally.
13. She has mild scoliosis.
14. Patient is diagnosed with autistic spectrum disorder.

sentences:
1. A 58-year-old woman presents to the clinic with an abnormal sensation on the left side of her body that has been present for the past several months.
2. At first, the area seemed numb and she recalls touching a hot stove and accidentally burning herself but not feeling the heat.
3. Now she is suffering from a constant, uncomfortable burning pain on her left side for the past week.
4. The pain gets worse when someone even lightly touches that side.
5. She has recently immigrated and her past medical records are unavailable.
6. Last month she had a stroke
7. but she cannot recall any details from the event.
8. She confirms a history of hypertension, type II diabetes mellitus, and bilateral knee pain.
9. She also had cardiac surgery 20 years ago.
10. She denies fever, mood changes, weight changes, and trauma to the head, neck, or limbs.
11. Her blood pressure is 162/90 mm
12. Hg, the heart rate is 82/min, and the respiratory rate is 15/min.
13. Multiple old burn marks are visible on the left hand and forearm.
14. Muscle strength is mildly reduced in the left upper and lower limbs.
15. Hyperesthesia is noted in the left upper and lower limbs.
16. The patient is diagnosed with complex regional pain syndrome after labs return.
17. Laboratory results are significant for:
18. Hemoglobin 13.9 g
19. /dL
20. MCV 92
21. fL
22. White blood cells
23. 7,500/mm3 Platelets
24. 278,000/mm3 Creatinine 1.3
25. U/L BUN
26. 38 mg/dL
27. TSH 2.5 uU/L
28. Hemoglobin
29. A1c 7.9%
30. Vitamin
31. B12 526 ng/L
32. What is the most likely diagnosis?

sentences:
1. A 65-year-old man is brought into the emergency department by his wife for slurred speech and right-sided weakness.
2. The patient has a significant past medical history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia.
3. The wife reports her husband went to bed last night normally but woke up this morning with the symptoms mentioned.
4. Physical examination shows right-sided hemiparesis along with the loss of vibration and proprioception.
5. Cranial nerve examination shows a deviated tongue to the left.
6. The patient is diagnosed with medial pontine syndrome.

corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with Dejerine syndrome.

sentences:
1. A 23-year-old man presents with sudden loss of consciousness while pitching in a baseball game.
2. There is no history of injury.
3. Consciousness is regained after cardiopulmonary resuscitation.
4. Past medical history is negative for any neurological and cardiovascular problems.
5. Patient is diagnosed with aortic stenosis after physical examination reveals a prominent A wave on the jugular venous pulse and a double apical impulse.
6. There are no audible murmurs.
7. An S4 is present.

sentences:
1. A 35-year-old woman presents to her family doctor worried that she might have a heart condition.
2. For the past 7 months, she has been having short panic attacks where she feels short of breath, sweaty, and feels like her heart wants to jump out her chest.
3. During these attacks, she feels like she 'is going crazy'.
4. She has now mapped out all of the places she has had an attack such as the subway, the crowded pharmacy near her house, and an elevator at her work that is especially slow and poorly lit.
5. She actively avoids these areas to prevent an additional episode.
6. She is afraid that during these attacks she may not be able to get the help she needs or escape if needed.
7. No significant past medical history.
8. The patient takes no current medications.
9. Her grandfather died of a heart attack at the age of 70 and she is worried that it might run in the family.
10. The patient is afebrile and vital signs are within normal limits.
11. Laboratory results are unremarkable.
12. Patient is diagnosed with panic disorder.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with panic disorder.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with panic disorder and agoraphobia.

No significant past medical history. The patient takes no current medications. Her grandfather died of a heart attack at the age of 70 and she is worried that it might run in the family. The patient is afebrile and vital signs are within normal limits. Laboratory results are unremarkable. Patient is diagnosed with panic disorder and agoraphobia.

metadata.original_text: A 35-year-old woman presents to her family doctor worried that she might have a heart condition. For the past 7 months, she has been having short panic attacks where she feels short of breath, sweaty, and feels like her heart wants to jump out her chest. During these attacks, she feels like she 'is going crazy'. She has now mapped out all of the places she has had an attack such as the subway, the crowded pharmacy near her house, and an elevator at her work that is especially slow and poorly lit. She actively avoids these areas to prevent an additional episode. She is afraid that during these attacks she may not be able wto get the help she needs or escape if needed. No significant past medical history. The patient takes no current medications. Her grandfather died of a heart attack at the age of 70 and she is worried that it might run in the family. The patient is afebrile and vital signs are within normal limits. Patient is diagnosed with panic disorder and agorapobia after laboratory results are unremarkable.

sentences:

2. His mother states that the patient barely engages in any physical activity as he becomes short of breath easily.
3. The prenatal and birth histories are insignificant.
4. Past medical history includes a few episodes of upper respiratory tract infection that were treated successfully.
5. The patient is in the 10th percentile for weight and 40th percentile for height.
6. The vital signs include: heart rate 122/min and respirations
7. 32/min.

9. The remainder of the physical examination is negative for clubbing, cyanosis, and peripheral edema.

sentences:
1. A 25-year-old woman is brought to a psychiatrist's office by her husband who states that he is worried about her recent behavior, as it has become more violent.
2. The patient's husband states that his family drove across the country to visit them and that his wife 'threatened
3. his parents with a knife' at dinner last night.
4. Police had to be called to calm her down.
5. He states that she has been acting 'really
6. crazy' for the last 9 months, and the initial behavior that caused him alarm was her admission that his deceased sister was talking to her through a decorative piece of ceramic art in the living room.
7. Initially, he thought she was joking, but soon realized her complaints of 'hearing
8. ghosts' talking to her throughout the house were persisting and 'getting
9. worse'.
10. There was also a 4-week period where she experienced insomnia and an unintentional weight loss of 12 pounds.
11. She seemed sad throughout these episodes, and, according to her husband, was complaining of feeling 'worthless'.
12. Her general hygiene has also suffered from her recent lack of motivation and she insists that the 'ghosts' are asking her to kill as many people as she can
13. so they won't be alone in the house.
14. Her husband is extremely concerned that she may harm herself or someone else.
15. He states that she currently does not take any medications or illicit drugs as far as he knows.
16. She does not smoke or drink alcohol.
17. The patient herself does not make eye contact or want to speak to the psychiatrist, allowing her husband to speak on her behalf.
18. Patient is diagnosed with schizophrenia.

corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with schizoaffective disorder.

Police had to be called to calm her down. He states that she has been acting 'really crazy' for the last 9 months, and the initial behavior that caused him alarm was her admission that his deceased sister was talking to her through a decorative piece of ceramic art in the living room. Initially, he thought she was joking, but soon realized her complaints of 'hearing ghosts' talking to her throughout the house were persisting and 'getting worse'. There was also a 4-week period where she experienced insomnia and an unintentional weight loss of 12 pounds. She seemed sad throughout these episodes, and, according to her husband, was complaining of feeling 'worthless'. Her general hygiene has also suffered from her recent lack of motivation and she insists that the 'ghosts' are asking her to kill as many people as she can so they won't be alone in the house. Her husband is extremely concerned that she may harm herself or someone else. He states that she currently does not take any medications or illicit drugs as far as he knows. She does not smoke or drink alcohol. The patient herself does not make eye contact or want to speak to the psychiatrist, allowing her husband to speak on her behalf. Patient is diagnosed with schizoaffective disorder.

sentences:
1. A 17-year-old boy with behavioral changes is brought in by his concerned parents.
2. The patient's parents say that he has been acting very odd and having difficulty academically for the past 4 months.
3. The patient says that he has been worried and distracted because he is certain the government is secretly recording him although he cannot provide a reason
4. why.
5. He mentions that he does feel depressed sometimes and no longer gets joy out of playing the guitar and his other previous activities.
6. He has no significant past medical history.
7. The patient denies any history of smoking, alcohol consumption, or recreational drug use.
8. He is afebrile, and his vital signs are within normal limits.
9. Physical examination is unremarkable.
10. On mental status examination, the patient is slightly disheveled and unkempt.
11. He has a disorganized monotonous speech pattern.
12. He expresses tangential thinking and has a flat affect.
13. Patient is diagnosed with schizophrenia when during the exam, it is clear that he suffers from auditory hallucinations.

sentences:
1. A 32-year-old woman presents to the emergency department due to severe, intractable headaches, and bilateral ocular pain.
2. Her symptoms began approximately 2 weeks prior to presentation and have progressively worsened.
3. She initially had right-sided headaches that were sharp, interfered with sleep, and were unresponsive to pain medications.
4. The headache was around her right eye and cheek, and she noticed diplopia with right lateral gaze.
5. Her symptoms were accompanied by fatigue, fever, and edema around the right eye.
6. Approximately 2 days after these symptoms, she developed swelling around the left eye.
7. Medical history is significant for a recent rhinosinusitis infection.
8. Her temperature is 101 F (38.3 C), blood pressure is 133/72
9. mmHg, pulse is 90/min, and respirations are 18/min.
10. On physical exam, there is ptosis, proptosis, chemosis, and periorbital swelling of both eyes.
11. There is hyperesthesia in the bilateral ophthalmic and maxillary divisions of the trigeminal nerve.
12. Fundoscopic exam demonstrates bilateral papilledema.
13. There is mydriasis and eye muscle weakness in all directions.
14. The patient is diagnosed with orbital cellulitis.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with orbital cellulitis.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with cavernous sinus thrombosis.

Approximately 2 days after these symptoms, she developed swelling around the left eye. Medical history is significant for a recent rhinosinusitis infection. Her temperature is 101 F (38.3 C), blood pressure is 133/72 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, and respirations are 18/min. On physical exam, there is ptosis, proptosis, chemosis, and periorbital swelling of both eyes. There is hyperesthesia in the bilateral ophthalmic and maxillary divisions of the trigeminal nerve. Fundoscopic exam demonstrates bilateral papilledema. There is mydriasis and eye muscle weakness in all directions. The patient is diagnosed with cavernous sinus thrombosis.

6 Medical history is significant for a recent rhinosinusitis infection.
7 Her temperature is 101 F (38.3 C), blood pressure is 133/72
8 mmHg, pulse is 90/min, and respirations are 18/min.
9 The patient is diagnosed with cavernous sinus thrombosis after physical exam.
10 On physical exam, there is ptosis, proptosis, chemosis, and periorbital swelling of both eyes.
11 There is hyperesthesia in the bilateral ophthalmic and maxillary divisions of the trigeminal nerve.
12 Fundoscopic exam demonstrates bilateral papilledema.
13 There is mydriasis and eye muscle weakness in all directions.

sentences:
1. A 22-year-old woman presents to her primary care physician complaining of a red, itchy rash on her elbows and shoulders for 2 months.
2. She has no history of medical problems, and review of systems is positive only for occasional loose stools.
3. She is appropriately prescribed dapsone, which relieves the rash within hours.
4. Patient is diagnosed with porphyria cutanea tarda.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with porphyria cutanea tarda.

sentences:
1. A 2-year-old girl is brought in to the office by her parents.
2. They state that their daughter has recently been more irritable than usual, and she occasionally becomes pale and blue.
3. Her parents note that she was diagnosed with a heart murmur, but it was never treated.
4. Patent ductus arteriosus is suspected after the exam is completed.
5. Physical examination revealed a small child in distress.
6. She was laying on the examination table with her knees drawn to her chest.
7. Cardiac auscultation revealed a harsh, systolic ejection murmur that was best heard at the upper left sternal border.
error_sentence: Patent ductus arteriosus is suspected after the exam is completed.
corrected_sentence: Tetralogy of Fallot is suspected after the exam is completed.

sentences:
1. A 2-month-old infant presents to a pediatric clinic for a well-child visit.
2. The mother, a recent immigrant from El Salvador, delivered her child in the United States with an unclear prenatal history.
3. Through a translator, she states that her child sleeps throughout the day and night but has also had three "flu" episodes during which the infant coughed and felt feverish.
4. She managed each episode using traditional non-pharmacological remedies.
5. She also states that because the baby sleeps so much, he rarely breastfeeds.
6. On physical exam, the patient is 5th percentile for weight and height.
7. He has a hyperinflated thorax and is tachypneic.
8. Auscultation of the heart reveals a pansystolic murmur heard at the left lower sternal border and a diastolic rumble at the apex.
9. Chest radiography is shown in Figure A. Patient is diagnosed with a atrial septal defect.
error_sentence: Chest radiography is shown in Figure A. Patient is diagnosed with a atrial septal defect.
corrected_sentence: Chest radiography is shown in Figure A. Patient is diagnosed with ventricular septal defect.

On physical exam, the patient is 5th percentile for weight and height. He has a hyperinflated thorax and is tachypneic. Auscultation of the heart reveals a pansystolic murmur heard at the left lower sternal border and a diastolic rumble at the apex. Chest radiography is shown in Figure A. Patient is diagnosed with ventricular septal defect.

sentences:
1. A 17-year-old girl is brought into the clinic by her mother who is concerned that she may be depressed.
2. The mother states that her daughter feels unattractive and does not fit into any of the social groups at school.
3. When talking to the patient, it is discovered that she mostly avoids the kids in school because of fear of rejection.
4. She usually keeps to herself and says she hasn't involved herself in any group activities since elementary school.
5. The patient is diagnosed with social phobia.
6. The patient's mother is worried that this kind of behavior might continue or worsen if it progresses into her college years.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with social phobia.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with avoidant personality disorder.
corrected_text: A 17-year-old girl is brought into the clinic by her mother who is concerned that she may be depressed. When talking to the patient, it is discovered that she mostly avoids the kids in school because of fear of rejection. She usually keeps to herself and says she hasn't involved herself in any group activities since elementary school. The patient is diagnosed with avoidant personality disorder. The patient's mother is worried that this kind of behavior might continue or worsen if it progresses into her college years.

sentences:
1. A 66-year-old man is brought into the emergency department by his daughter for a change in behavior.
2. Yesterday the patient seemed more confused than usual and was asking the same questions repetitively.
3. His symptoms have not improved over the past 24 hours, thus the decision to bring him in today.
4. Last year, the patient was almost completely independent but he then suffered a "series of falls," after which his ability to care for himself declined.
5. After this episode he was no longer able to cook for himself or pay his bills but otherwise had been fine up until this episode.
6. The patient has a past medical history of myocardial infarction, hypertension, depression, diabetes mellitus type II, constipation, diverticulitis, and peripheral neuropathy.
7. His current medications include metformin, insulin, lisinopril, hydrochlorothiazide, sodium docusate, atorvastatin, metoprolol, fluoxetine, and gabapentin.
8. On exam you note a confused man who is poorly kept.
9. He has bruises over his legs and his gait seems unstable.
10. He is alert to person and place, and answers some questions inappropriately.
11. The patient's pulse is 90/minute and his blood pressure is 170/100
12. mmHg.
13. The patient is diagnosed with Alzheimer's dementia.
error_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with Alzheimer's dementia.
corrected_sentence: The patient is diagnosed with vascular dementia.
corrected_text: A 66-year-old man is brought into the emergency department by his daughter for a change in behavior. Yesterday the patient seemed more confused than usual and was asking the same questions repetitively. His symptoms have not improved over the past 24 hours, thus the decision to bring him in today. Last year, the patient was almost completely independent but he then suffered a "series of falls," after which his ability to care for himself declined. After this episode he was no longer able to cook for himself or pay his bills but otherwise had been fine up until this episode. The patient has a past medical history of myocardial infarction, hypertension, depression, diabetes mellitus type II, constipation, diverticulitis, and peripheral neuropathy. His current medications include metformin, insulin, lisinopril, hydrochlorothiazide, sodium docusate, atorvastatin, metoprolol, fluoxetine, and gabapentin. On exam you note a confused man who is poorly kept. He has bruises over his legs and his gait seems unstable. He is alert to person and place, and answers some questions inappropriately. The patient's pulse is 90/minute and his blood pressure is 170/100 mmHg. The patient is diagnosed with vascular dementia.

metadata.original_text: A 66-year-old man is brought into the emergency department by his daughter for a change in behavior. Yesterday the patient seemed more confused than usual and was asking the same questions repetitively. His symptoms have not improved over the past 24 hours, thus the decision to bring him in today. Last year, the patient was almost completely independent but he then suffered a "series of falls," after which his ability to care for himself declined. After this episode he was no longer able to cook for himself or pay his bills but otherwise had been fine up until this episode. The patient has a past medical history of myocardial infarction, hypertension, depression, diabetes mellitus type II, constipation, diverticulitis, and peripheral neuropathy. His current medications include metformin, insulin, lisinopril, hydrochlorothiazide, sodium docusate, atorvastatin, metoprolol, fluoxetine, and gabapentin. On exam you note a confused man who is poorly kept. He has bruises over his legs and his gait seems unstable. He is alert to person and place, and answers some questions inappropriately. The patient's pulse is 90/minute and his blood pressure is 170/100 mmHg. The patient is diagnosed with Alzheimer's dementia.

sentences:
1. A 25-year-old male presents with progressively worsening headaches over the past two months.
2. He also feels that he has been losing his balance more often over the past week, but he denies any motor weakness or sensory impairment.
3. His neurological exam reveals impaired upward gaze, pupils that constrict poorly to light but react to accommodation, and bilateral upper eyelid retraction.
4. On tandem walking, he tends to fall on both sides.
5. The remainder of the physical examination is unremarkable.
6. Patient is diagnosed with a pituitary mass.

5. mmHg, pulse is 100/min, and respirations are 28/min.

metadata.original_text:
A 1-day-old male is seen in the neonatal intensive care unit for respiratory distress. He was born at 37 weeks to a 24-year-old G3P11011 Rh- mother who had no prenatal care. On physical examination, temperature is 99 F (37.2 C), blood pressure is 120/85 mmHg, pulse is 120/min, respirations are 26/min, and pulse oximetry is 92% on room air. There is abdominal distention with a positive fluid wave. Patient is diagnosed with erythroblastosis fetalis after laboratory results are as follows:

Serum:
Alkaline phosphatase: 80 U/L
ALT: 33 U/L
AST: 32 U/L
Bilirubin (total): 10 mg/dL
Bilirubin (conjugated): 0.2 mg/dL
Amylase: 76 U/L

Leukocyte count: 5,000/mm^3 with normal differential
Hemoglobin: 8 g/dL
Platelet count: 200,000/mm^3
Mean corpuscular volume: 80 µm^3
Reticulocyte count: 3%

sentences:
1. A 23-year-old African American G1P0 woman at 18 weeks estimated gestational age presents with fatigue and lethargy.
2. She says the symptoms onset gradually about 1 week ago and have progressively worsened.
3. She has been otherwise healthy.
4. Past medical history is unremarkable.
5. She denies smoking, drug or alcohol use.
6. The patient is afebrile and vital signs are within normal limits.
7. Her physical examination is unremarkable.
8. Her blood count shows the following:
9. Hemoglobin 10.8 g/dL
10. Red blood cell count 5.7 million/mm3
11. Mean corpuscular volume (MCV)
12. 76
13. m3
14. Red cell distribution width 12.4% (ref: 11.5-14.5%)
15. She is empirically started on ferrous gluconate tablets.
16. Five weeks later, she shows no improvement in her hemoglobin level.
17. Hemoglobin electrophoresis is normal.
18. Patient is diagnosed with beta-thalassemia trait.
error_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with beta-thalassemia trait.
corrected_sentence: Patient is diagnosed with alpha-thalassemia trait.
corrected_text:
A 23-year-old African American G1P0 woman at 18 weeks estimated gestational age presents with fatigue and lethargy. She says the symptoms onset gradually about 1 week ago and have progressively worsened. She has been otherwise healthy. Past medical history is unremarkable. She denies smoking, drug or alcohol use. The patient is afebrile and vital signs are within normal limits. Her physical examination is unremarkable. Her blood count shows the following:
Hemoglobin 10.8 g/dL
Red blood cell count 5.7 million/mm3
Mean corpuscular volume (MCV) 76  m3
Red cell distribution width 12.4% (ref: 11.5-14.5%)
She is empirically started on ferrous gluconate tablets. Five weeks later, she shows no improvement in her hemoglobin level. Hemoglobin electrophoresis is normal. Patient is diagnosed with alpha-thalassemia trait.
